info.description:

name.description: References the configured name of the ssid

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

rx-mcs.description:
Received Data frames, per MCS Index. It is expected that
         vendors bucketize 802.11n MCS frames in their matching
         802.11ac buckets.

         Example, 802.11n MCS 15 = 802.11ac MCS 7.
         802.11n MCS 20 = 802.11ac MCS 4.

          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

Top-level container for WMM configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

Top-level container for 802.11r configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

Top-level container for 802.11v configuration and

rssi.description:
The RSSI of this client in dBm. Expressed as negative
          number

snr.description: The SNR of AP to Client, in dB.

ss.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

phy-rate.description: Last used PHY rate of connected client.

frequency.description:
Frequency the client is utilizing. Typically, 2.4 or
          5[GHz].

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

rx-mcs.description:
Received Data frames, per MCS Index. It is expected that
         vendors bucketize 802.11n MCS frames in their matching
         802.11ac buckets.

         Example, 802.11n MCS 15 = 802.11ac MCS 7.
         802.11n MCS 20 = 802.11ac MCS 4.

          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

rx-mcs.description:
Received Data frames, per MCS Index. It is expected that
         vendors bucketize 802.11n MCS frames in their matching
         802.11ac buckets.

         Example, 802.11n MCS 15 = 802.11ac MCS 7.
         802.11n MCS 20 = 802.11ac MCS 4.

bssids.description: Top-level container for BSSIDs operational state data.

name.description: References the configured name of the ssid

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

wmm.description:
Top-level container for WMM configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

dot11r.description:
Top-level container for 802.11r configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

dot11v.description:
Top-level container for 802.11v configuration and
        operational state data.

rssi.description:
The RSSI of this client in dBm. Expressed as negative
          number

snr.description: The SNR of AP to Client, in dB.

ss.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

phy-rate.description: Last used PHY rate of connected client.

frequency.description:
Frequency the client is utilizing. Typically, 2.4 or
          5[GHz].

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

rx-32769-65536.description: Transmitted AMPDU or MPDUs from 32769 to 65536 Bytes.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

be.description: Rx Data frames marked as Access Category Best Effort.

rx-mcs.description:
Received Data frames, per MCS Index. It is expected that
         vendors bucketize 802.11n MCS frames in their matching
         802.11ac buckets.

         Example, 802.11n MCS 15 = 802.11ac MCS 7.
         802.11n MCS 20 = 802.11ac MCS 4.

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

wmm.description:
Top-level container for WMM configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.
TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

dot11r.description:
Top-level container for 802.11r configuration and
        state container.

dot11r-r1key-timeout.description: TTL for the Pairwise Master Key R1.

dot11v.description:
Top-level container for 802.11v configuration and
        operational state data.

rssi.description:
The RSSI of this client in dBm. Expressed as negative
          number

snr.description: The SNR of AP to Client, in dB.

ss.description: Number of Spatial Streams supported by the client.

phy-rate.description: Last used PHY rate of connected client.

frequency.description:
Frequency the client is utilizing. Typically, 2.4 or
          5[GHz].

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.

rx-data-dist.description:
The distribution of Data frame sizes in bytes of
          successfully recieved AMPDU, or MPDU for non-aggregated,
          frames. The distribution should characterize frame sizes
          starting at 64 bytes or less with the bin size doubling for
          each successive bin to a maximum of 1MB or larger, as
          represented in the following table:

          Lower Bound Upper Bound
             0          64
             65         128
             129        256
             257        512
             513        1024
             1025       2048
             2049       4096
             4097       8192
             8193       16384
             16385      32768
             32769      65536
             65537      131072
             131073     262144
             262145     524288
             524289     1048576

vi.description: Rx Data frames marked as Access Category Video.

vo.description: Rx Data frames marked as Access Category Voice.

be.description: Rx Data frames marked as Access Category Best Effort.

bk.description: Rx Data frames marked as Access Category Background.

rx-data-wmm.description: Received 802.11 Data frames, per WMM Access Category.

rx-mcs.description:
Received Data frames, per MCS Index. It is expected that
         vendors bucketize 802.11n MCS frames in their matching
         802.11ac buckets.

         Example, 802.11n MCS 15 = 802.11ac MCS 7.
         802.11n MCS 20 = 802.11ac MCS 4.

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this SSID.

hidden.description: Whether this SSID IE is hidden within Beacons.

default-vlan.description:
Default VLAN tag used by the SSID. When unspecified, SSID
        defaults to untagged. If DVA enabled and RADIUS returns a
        VLAN not present in 'vlan-list', or RADIUS returns no VLAN
        (Tunnel-Private-Group-Id), this VLAN will be used. If DVA
        not enabled, all packets are tagged with this VLAN.

operating-frequency.description:
Operating frequency of this SSID. When none specified, the
        default is dual-band.

broadcast-filter.description:
Convert all downstream broadcast ARP to unicast
        only if Station is associated to the AP. Drop packet
        if Station is not associated to the AP. All other
        broadcast, except DHCP, is dropped by the AP.

        DHCP Offers/ACKs are converted to Unicast, over-the-air.

ipv6-ndp-filter.description:
Neighbor Advertisements will be cached at the AP (or WLC)
        and unicast in response to Neighbor Solicitations.

        Router Advertisements, in response to a Router Solicitation
        are converted to Unicast for over-the-air transmission.

ipv6-ndp-filter-timer.description:
Time, in seconds, the ndp-filter will cache
        Neighbor Advertisements (NA).

station-isolation.description: Block Station peer to peer communication.

wpa2-psk.description: The passphrase used on this WPA2-Personal SSID.

server-group.description:
Specifies the RADIUS server-group to be used,
          as defined in the openconfig-aaa.yang model.

          Including WPA2_PERSONAL as it can be accompained by MAB.

dva.description:
Enable/disable Dynamic VLAN Assignment,
        using 'Tunnel-Private-Group-Id' RADIUS attribute.

mobility-domain.description:
Specify the mobility domain where PMK-R0 distribution will
        occur. Specifically, which APs will recieve PMK-R0 if using
        802.11r (FT).

dhcp-required.description:
Allow a Station to access the network only if
        a DHCP exchange has occurred.

qbss-load.description: Advertisement of the QBSS Load Information ELement.

advertise-apname.description: Advertise the AP hostname in Beacon and Probe Resp. frames.

ptk-timeout.description: Time, in seconds, for the Pairwise Transient Key.

gtk-timeout.description: TTL for the Group Temporal Key.

items.description:
List of VLANs allowed on the SSID, if DVA is enabled. Note,
        if DVA enabled and RADIUS returns no VLAN or a VLAN outside
        of this list, the SSID will be tagged with the value of
        vlan-id (or untagged if 'vlan-id' not configured).
Basic data-rates for the SSID.

Supported data-rates for the SSID. This list should be
        mutually exclusive with basic-data-rates.
